name: NSTintConfiguration
desc: An object that gives you the ability to choose from system-provided tinting behaviors.

items.name: init(fixedColor: NSColor)
items.desc: Creates a new tint configuration using a specific color value.

items.name: init(preferredColor: NSColor)
items.desc: Creates a new tint configuration for the system to use when the app’s preferred accent color is in use.

items.name: var adaptsToUserAccentColor: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the tint configuration alters its effect based on the user’s preferred accent color choice.

items.name: class var `default`: NSTintConfiguration
items.desc: The system tints the content using the system default value for its context.

items.name: class var monochrome: NSTintConfiguration
items.desc: The content always displays in monochrome.

items.name: var baseTintColor: NSColor?
items.desc: The color the system supplies when you create a tint configuration.

items.name: var equivalentContentTintColor: NSColor?
items.desc: A color object that matches the effective content tint.
